title: The Great Gatsby
content: A novel set in the Roaring Twenties, it tells the story of Jay Gatsby's obsession with Daisy Buchanan.
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

content: A dystopian novel that explores the dangers of totalitarianism and extreme political ideology.
author: George Orwell

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
content: A coming-of-age story about racism and injustice in the Deep South, seen through the eyes of a young girl.
author: Harper Lee

title: Moby Dick
content: The narrative of Captain Ahab's obsessive quest to kill the giant white whale, Moby Dick.
author: Herman Melville

title: Pride and Prejudice
content: A romantic novel that critiques the British landed gentry at the end of the 18th century.
author: Jane Austen

title: The Catcher in the Rye
content: A story about teenage alienation and loss of innocence, narrated by Holden Caulfield.
author: J.D. Salinger

title: Brave New World
content: A dystopian novel that examines a technologically advanced society and its implications for humanity.
author: Aldous Huxley

title: Fahrenheit 451
content: A novel about a future where books are banned and 'firemen' burn any that are found.
author: Ray Bradbury

title: The Alchemist
content: A philosophical book about a shepherd's journey to find treasure and discover his personal legend.
author: Paulo Coelho

title: Wuthering Heights
content: A tale of passion and revenge between Heathcliff and Catherine Earnshaw on the Yorkshire moors.
author: Emily BrontÃ«

title: The Odyssey
content: An epic poem that follows Odysseus's long journey home after the Trojan War.
author: Homer

title: Crime and Punishment
content: A psychological thriller that explores morality through the story of Raskolnikov, a young man who commits murder.
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
content: A novel about a young man whose portrait ages while he remains young and beautiful.
author: Oscar Wilde

title: The Grapes of Wrath
content: A story about a family fleeing the Dust Bowl in search of a better life in California.
author: John Steinbeck

title: The Road
content: A post-apocalyptic novel following a father and son as they journey through a desolate America.
author: Cormac McCarthy

title: Little Women
content: A coming-of-age story about the four March sisters as they navigate life and love in Civil War America.
author: Louisa May Alcott

title: The Bell Jar
content: A semi-autobiographical novel about a young woman's descent into mental illness.
author: Sylvia Plath

title: The Kite Runner
content: A story of friendship and redemption set against the backdrop of a changing Afghanistan.
author: Khaled Hosseini

title: The Fault in Our Stars
content: A poignant love story between two teenagers who meet at a cancer support group.
author: John Green

title: The Road
content: A harrowing tale of survival and the bond between a father and son in a post-apocalyptic world.
author: Cormac McCarthy

title: Gone with the Wind
content: A historical novel set during the American Civil War, focusing on Scarlett O'Hara's struggles.
author: Margaret Mitchell

title: The Hobbit
content: A fantasy novel that follows Bilbo Baggins on his adventure with a group of dwarves.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

title: The Chronicles of Narnia
content: A series of seven fantasy novels set in the magical land of Narnia.
author: C.S. Lewis

title: The Catch-22
content: A satirical novel about the absurdities of war and military life.
author: Joseph Heller

title: The Sound and the Fury
content: A complex novel that explores the decline of the Compson family in the American South.
author: William Faulkner

title: The Secret Garden
content: A children's novel about a girl who discovers a hidden, neglected garden.
author: Frances Hodgson Burnett

title: Mansfield Park
content: A novel that explores themes of class, morality, and relationships in early 19th-century England.
author: Jane Austen

title: The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy
content: A comedic science fiction series that follows the adventures of Arthur Dent in space.
author: Douglas Adams

title: A Tale of Two Cities
content: A historical novel set in London and Paris before and during the French Revolution.
author: Charles Dickens

title: The Old Man and the Sea
content: A short novel about an old fisherman's epic struggle with a giant marlin.
author: Ernest Hemingway
